title: Pink swings from chandelier during at Rock In Rio Music Festival
text:
Pink took her acrobats to dizzying new heights (Picture: Backgrid)

Pink took her famous acrobatic-style performance to new heights at the Rock In Rio Music Festival, with the popstar swinging from chandeliers on-stage.

The Just Give Me A Reason singer graced the stage at the Olympic Park in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil on Saturday to headline this year’s installment of the annual music festival.

And it’s safe to say that Pink, 40, got the party started and delivered a standout performance thanks to her dizzying acrobatics.

After being suspended in the air, Pink was seen dangling from a particularly large chandelier with seemingly no fear whatsoever. She then looped her legs into a hoop and hung upside down all the while still managing to sing.

Hugh Jackman has some competition from the Greatest Show(wo)man.

Pink treated the packed-out audience to a host of her biggest hits, including So What, Who Knew, Just Like Fire, What About Us and Raise Your Glass.

Following the incredible performance, Pink posted on Instagram: ‘That’s me up top, 100,000 strong tonight. My heart is so full Rio. Thank you for having this lady as your headliner this year.

But, how? (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

Another day, another Pink performance of acrobats (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

The woman is unreal (Picture: Backgrid)

It was the penultimate show on Pink’s epic tour (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

‘I’ve been waiting to meet you all for a long long time. I love y’all.’

It’s no surprise that Pink was keen to pull out all the stops for the festival performance, as it was the penultimate show on her epic Beautiful Trauma World Tour.

Pink launched the mammoth trek on 1 March 2018 and has since performed an exhaustive 159 shows, grossing an estimated $397.3 million (£318 million).

But like all good things, it will end on 2 November with a final show at Circuit of the Americas in Austin.

No doubt the popstar will be pleased to spend some quality time with her family – husband Carey Hart and children Willow, eight, and Jameson, two.

It was just last week that Pink enjoyed a big family reunion at Blackberry Farm and it’s safe to say that fun was had by all.
